fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.sender

Class SenderImplementationBuilderHelper<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.sender.SenderImplementationBuilderHelper<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder MessageSender Builder

    public class SenderImplementationBuilderHelper<P>
extends Object
    Helps to configure a MultiImplementationSender.

    It registers and uses Builders to instantiate and configure a MessageSender implementation.

    It also let you provide your own direct MessageSender implementation.

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • SenderImplementationBuilderHelper

        public SenderImplementationBuilderHelper(P parent,
                                         BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling and() method of any registered Message Builder. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties at build time (when addSenders(MultiImplementationSender) is called).
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • hasRegisteredSenders

        public boolean hasRegisteredSenders()
        Returns true if at least either one custom sender or a sender builder was previously registered.
        Returns:
        true if at least one custom sender or one sender builder

      • customSender

        public void customSender(MessageSender sender)
        Registers a custom message sender implementation.

        If your custom implementation is annotated by one or several of:

        • RequiredClass
        • RequiredProperty
        • RequiredClasses
        • RequiredProperties
        Then if condition evaluation returns true, your implementation will be used. If you provide several annotations, your implementation will be used only if all conditions are met (and operator).

        If your custom implementation implements ActivableAtRuntime, and the provided condition evaluation returns true, then your implementation will be used. See MessageConditions to build your condition.

        If neither annotations nor implementation of ActivableAtRuntime is used, then your custom implementation will be always used. All other implementations (even standard ones) will never be used.

        Parameters:
        sender - the sender to register

      • register

        public <B extends Builder<? extends MessageSender>> B register(Class<B> builderClass)
        Registers and configures sender through a dedicated builder. For example: 
         .register(JavaMailBuilder.class)
     .host("localhost");

        If your custom builder is annotated by one or several of:

        • RequiredClass
        • RequiredProperty
        • RequiredClasses
        • RequiredProperties
        Then if condition evaluation returns true, your built implementation will be used. If you provide several annotations, your built implementation will be used only if all conditions are met (and operator).

        If your custom builder implements ActivableAtRuntime, and the provided condition evaluation returns true, then your built implementation will be used. See MessageConditions to build your condition.

        If neither annotations nor implementation of ActivableAtRuntime is used, then your built implementation will be always used. All other implementations (even standard ones) will never be used.

        In order to be able to keep chaining, you builder instance may provide a constructor with one argument with the type of the parent builder (&lt;P&gt;). If you don't care about chaining, just provide a default constructor.

        Your builder may return null when calling Builder.build(). In this case it means that your implementation can't be used due to current environment. Your implementation is then not registered.

        Type Parameters:
        B - the type of the builder
        Parameters:
        builderClass - the builder class to instantiate
        Returns:
        the builder to configure the implementation

      • addSenders

        public void addSenders(MultiImplementationSender<?> mainSender)
        Add registered custom senders or built senders base on registered sender builders to the provided MultiImplementationSender.

        A MultiImplementationSender is able to evaluate a Condition when a message is being sent to determine which implementation can and should handle the message and really send it.

        If a custom implementation was registered and is annotated by one or several of:

        • RequiredClass
        • RequiredProperty
        • RequiredClasses
        • RequiredProperties
        Then if condition evaluation returns true, the custom implementation will be used. If you provide several annotations, the custom implementation will be used only if all conditions are met (and operator).

        If a custom implementation was registered and implements ActivableAtRuntime, and the provided condition evaluation returns true, then the custom implementation will be used. See MessageConditions to build your condition.

        If neither annotations nor implementation of ActivableAtRuntime is used, then the custom implementation will be always used. All other implementations (even standard ones) will never be used.

        Parameters:
        mainSender - the sender that manages several implementations
